title: Mom's Best Peanut Brittle
method: Step 1: Have all ingredients measured out before starting.
Step 2: Grease a large rimmed baking sheet. Set aside.
Step 3: Combine sugar, corn syrup, water, and salt in a heavy, 2-quart saucepan over medium heat.
Step 4: Stir until sugar is dissolved and the mixture comes to a boil, about 5 minutes.
Step 5: Stir in peanuts and set a candy thermometer in place. Continue cooking, stirring occasionally, until the temperature reaches 300 to 310 degrees F (150 to 155 degrees C)

Step 6: Remove from the heat. Quickly stir in butter and baking soda, then immediately pour mixture onto the prepared baking sheet. Quickly use 2 forks to lift and pull the mixture into a 12x14-inch rectangle. Let cool until completely firm, at least 30 minutes.
Step 7: Use a mallet to break peanut brittle into pieces.
